gurmukhi: S`qR ibdwr hinE jb hI qb hI sRI biRjBUKn kop BrXo hY ] sXwm BnY qij kY sB SMk inSMk huie bYrn mwJ prXo hY ]
transliteration: Shattra Bidaar Hanio Jab Hitab Hisribrij-bhookhan Kop Bdaryo Hai|| Syaam Bhanai Taj(i) Kai Sabh Shank Nishank Hue Bairan Maajh Daryo Hai||
translation: Killing this enemy, Krishna being highly enraged, forsaking all hesitation’s jumped into the enemy’s army;

gurmukhi: BYriv BUp isau ju`D kIE su vhY iCn mY ibn pRwn krXo hY ] BUm igrXo rQ qy ieh BwNq mno nB qy giH tUt prXo hY ]1786]
transliteration: Bhairav(i) Bhoop Sio Juddh Keeo Su Vahai Chhin Mai Bin Praan Daryo Hai|| Bhoom Giryo Rath Te Eh Bhaant Mano Nabh Te Grah(i) Toot Pryo Hai||1786||
translation: He fought with king Bhairav Singh and killed him also in an instant and he fell down on the ground from his chariot like planet breaking and falling down from the sky.1786.

gurmukhi: eyk Bry Bt sRoNnq soN BBkwrq Gwie iPrY rn folq ] eyk pry igr kY DrnI iqn ky qn jMbk gIDk Folq ]
transliteration: Ek Bhare Bhat Sronat Son Bhabh-kaarat Ghaae Phirai Ran Dolat|| Ek Dare Gir Kai Dharnitin Ke Tan Janbak Geedhak Ddolat||
translation: The warriors are roaming in the battlefield, saturated with blood and with wounds full of pus; some have fallen on the earth and their bodies are being pulled by jackals and vultures;

gurmukhi: eykn ky muiK ETn AwNKn kwg su cocn isau tktolq ] eykn kI aur AwNqn ko kF jogn hwQn isau JkJolq ]1787]
transliteration: Ekan Ke Moukh(i) Othan Aankhan Kaag Su Chochanndsio Takdolat|| Ekan Kiur Aantan Ko Kadh Jogad Bhaa Than Sio Jhak-jdolat||1787||
translation: The crows are pulling with force the eyes and faces of many and the Yoginis are shaking in the hands the intestines of many others.1787.

gurmukhi: mwn Bry As pwn Dry chUM Ern qy bhuro Ar Awey ] sRI jdubIr ky ijqy kib sXwm khY ieq qy qyaU Dwey ]
transliteration: Maan Bhare As Paan Ddare Chahoon Oran Te Bahuro Ar Aae|| Srijadoubeerr Ke Jite Kabi Syaam Kahai Itt Te Teoo Dhaae||
translation: Taking their swords in their hands, the enemies fell upon Krishna’s army proudly from all the four directions; from this side Krishna’s warriors advanced,

gurmukhi: bwnn sYQn Aau krvwr hkwr hkwr pHwr lgwey ] Awie Key iek jIq ley iek Bwj gey iek mwr igrwey ]1788]
transliteration: Baanan Saithan Au Karvaar Hakaar Hakaar Prahaar Lagade|| Ooe Khae Ik Jeet Lae Ik Bhaaj Gad Ik Maar Giraae||1788||
translation: And challenging the enemy began to strike blows with their arrows, swords and daggers; those who come to fight, they are conquered, but many have fled away and many are being knocked down.1788.

gurmukhi: jo Bt Awhv mY kbhU Air kY lir kY pgu eyk n twry ] jIq iPrY sB dysn kaU soaU Bwj gey ijh Er inhwry ]
transliteration: Je Bhat Aahav Mai Kab-hoo Ar(i) Kai Pag(u) Ek Na Tdare|| Jeet Phirai Sabh Desan Kau Sooo Gad Jih Or Nihdare||
translation: Those warriors who did not even retrace one step while fighting; those who conquered all the countries and wherever they looked, the enemies fled away;

gurmukhi: jo jm ky sMig jUJ krY qb AMqk qy nhI jwie invwry ] qy Bt JUm pry rn mY jdubIr ky kop kiRpwn ky mwry ]1789]
transliteration: Jo Jam Ke San(i) Joojh Darai Tab Antak Te Nahijaae Nivdare|| Te Bhat Jhoom Dare Ran Mai Jadoubeer Ke Kop Kridaan Ke Mdare||1789||
translation: Who even fought with Yama and whom not even the god of death could kill, those warriors have been killed and laid down on the earth, by the angry sword of Krishna.1789.

gurmukhi: eyk huqo blbIr bfo jdubIr illwt mY bwn lgwXo ] Pok rhI gif Bauhir mY sru Cyd sBY isr pwr prwXo ]
transliteration: Ek Houto Balbeer Bado Jadoubeer Lilaat Mai Baan Lagadyo|| Phok Rahigad(i) Bhauhar(i) Mai Sar(u) Chhed Sabhai Sir Paar Paraayo||
translation: A mighty warrior of the enemy’s army shot one arrow on the forehead of Krishna, whose shell remained fixed in the eyebrows, but the arrow pierced through the head to the other side;

gurmukhi: sXwm khY aupmw iqh kI br Gwie lgy bhu sRon bhwXo ] mwnhu ieMdR pY kopu kIXo iSv qIsry nYn ko qyj idKwXo ]1790]
transliteration: Syaam Kahai Oupmaa Tih Kibar Ghaae Lge Bahu Sron Bahaayo|| Maanoh Indra Pai Kop(u) Keeyo Shiv Teesre Nain Ko Tej Dikhaayo||1790||
translation: According to the poet, good deal of blood flowed out from that wound and it seemed that Shiva in anger had shown to Indra the light of his third eye.1790.
